news_header: Almost 1.8 million farmed and captive birds have been culled in the UK due to avian flu outbreaks, with 33 reported cases. The government has mandated that bird-keepers in five additional counties house their flocks indoors.
news_original_title: Avian flu spread sees 1.8 million farmed birds culled
news_text: While the risk to humans remains low, the mental health impact on farmers is concerning. The government has acted to protect food security, but the emotional and financial strain on farming families is significant. Compensation will be provided for healthy birds culled due to disease control.
